meta.title: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

div.div: WORKING STIFFS

div.a: The Deadliest Job Isn't What You Expect

div.div: Fishing, logging, farming, and working as an aircraft pilot/flight engineer count among the most dangerous jobs in America. But in raw numbers, they are not the deadliest.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/NegrFS&via=Digg&text=The Deadliest Job Isn't What You Expect

div.div: IT'S HUGE... IN CHINA

div.a: The Largest Social Network You've Never Heard Of

div.div: 310 million registered users. Up to 8.45 million people using the site concurrently. 421 billion minutes of voice transferred in 2011. The potential for one video to be seen by millions of viewers.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Nf86Mq&via=Digg&text=The Largest Social Network You've Never Heard Of

div.div: PATENT TROLLS

div.a: Inside The Most Hated Company In Tech

div.div: Suffice to say, Intellectual Ventures is in the minds of many the world's biggest patent troll, waiting to demand a fee for what you were sure was an original idea. Is it the most hated company in tech? Well, you'd be hard pressed to find another outfit that causes quite as much outrage in Silicon Valley.

li.div: Go beyond the "innovation" vs "troll" cliches with this look at Intellectual Ventures: news.cnet.com/8301-13578_3-574... by @jimkerstetter and @josh

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/MJ4TJl&via=Digg&text=Inside The Most Hated Company In Tech

div.div: RACE
What the history of footwear reveals about a cultural divide -- and the appropriation of African American style.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OGR1eb&via=Digg&text=The Racial Divide On... Sneakers

div.div: HOW PLANET OF THE APES REALLY STARTED

div.a: Genius Chimp Makes Stone Tools Like Early Humans Did

div.div: Kanzi the bonobo continues to impress. Not content with learning sign language or making up "words" for things like banana or juice, he now seems capable of making stone tools on a par with the efforts of early humans.

li.div: It was earth all along! RT @newscientist Bonobo genius makes stone tools like early humans did newscientist.com/article/d...

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/MIW6Hn&via=Digg&text=Genius Chimp Makes Stone Tools Like Early Humans Did

div.div: QUACKERY

div.a: Quack Medicine And The U.S. Military

div.div: Injured in battle? A military acupuncturist will burn your skin with mugwort to fix it.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OTOUtp&via=Digg&text=Quack Medicine And The U.S. Military

div.div: FOOD

div.a: These Crayons Taste Nothing Like Crayons, Because They Are Actually String Cheese

div.div: Best product partnership ever? We think so.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Rc4dNe&via=Digg&text=These Crayons Taste Nothing Like Crayons, Because They Are Actually String Cheese

div.div: SO WHEN CAN WE THROW OUT OUR WALLETS?

div.a: Near Field Communication And The Trough of Disillusionment

div.div: NFC so far has been more hype rather than reality. According to research firm Gartner, the hype may soon be coming to an end.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PNjRiB&via=Digg&text=Near Field Communication And The Trough of Disillusionment

div.div: BOOM TIMES

div.a: Subway Explosion Rocks New York City Streets

div.div: A Second Ave. subway construction blast on the Upper East Side left city agencies scrambling to assess potential structural damage to surrounding buildings Tuesday afternoon, officials said.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PbpGCC&via=Digg&text=Subway Explosion Rocks New York City Streets

div.div: WHERE'S A GAME GENIE WHEN YOU NEED ONE?

div.a: Game Over For Nintendo Power Magazine

div.div: It's unclear exactly how many more issues of Nintendo Power are planned after the recently published August issue (its 281st), or how current subscribers will be compensated.

li.div: Nintendo Power began the same year I was born. Always wanted to write for them. Guess that dream may be dead. arstechnica.com/gaming/2012/08...
I haven't read it in at least a decade, but it's still sad to read that Nintendo Power is ceasing publication. arstechnica.com/gaming/2012/08...

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OuWQhL&via=Digg&text=Game Over For Nintendo Power Magazine

div.div: NOT THE FILET!

div.a: High-Grade Steak Prices Soar As Drought Culls Herds

div.div: The drought currently affecting the U.S. has worked its way up the food chain all the way to the finest cuts of beef.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PQ0yoM&via=Digg&text=High-Grade Steak Prices Soar As Drought Culls Herds

div.div: SPACE

div.a: What Mars Would Look Like If You Were Orbiting It

div.div: We know what the planet looks like from a distance. We know what it looks like from up close. But what about the space between? What would Mars look like if you were orbiting it?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OVPCX0&via=Digg&text=What Mars Would Look Like If You Were Orbiting It

div.div: MONKEY BUSINESS

div.a: Drunk Lab Tech Lowered Pants, Freed Monkeys

div.div: An experiment on primate alcoholism may have gotten out of control recently in Augusta where police found an allegedly intoxicated lab technician with his pants down in a room with uncaged monkeys.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PAH7ge&via=Digg&text=Drunk Lab Tech Lowered Pants, Freed Monkeys

div.div: ROTTEN TO THE CORP

div.a: Confessions From The Most Corrupt Apple Store In America

div.div: Ever been a jerk to an Apple Genius? Bad idea.

li.div: Crazy, horrible stuff going on at the most corrupt Apple Store in America. Exclusive by @samfbiddle gizmodo.com/5936324/exclusive-...

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PARSzb&via=Digg&text=Confessions From The Most Corrupt Apple Store In America

div.div: IT'S STILL NO 'MACARENA'
South Korean rapper, Psy, explains where the viral video's dance comes from.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SkLQag&via=Digg&text='Gagnam Style' Rapper Explains Horse Dance

div.div: INEQUALITY

div.a: How Well You Sleep May Hinge On Race

div.div: In the United States, at least, sleep is not colorblind.

li.div: If you are white you have better odds of sleeping through the night. nytimes.com/2012/08/21/hea...

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SjOL3d&via=Digg&text=How Well You Sleep May Hinge On Race

div.div: NOT SOMETHING YOU WANT TO BE STUCK IN

div.a: Will Space Elevators Ever Be More Than Science Fiction?

div.div: Science fiction fans have long been familiar with space elevators. Popularised by Arthur C Clarke, the concept of an elevator from the Earth to orbit has been around for more than a century.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QgTmN4&via=Digg&text=Will Space Elevators Ever Be More Than Science Fiction?

div.div: SIGNS OF THE TIMES

div.a: Road Signs For Seniors And Teens

div.div: Not everyone looks at road signs and sees the same thing.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SbIV3O&via=Digg&text=Road Signs For Seniors And Teens

div.div: THE INTERNET IS THE ONLY WINNER HERE

div.a: Lochte Trounces Prince Harry In Drunken Vegas Swim Race

div.div: The UK and the rogue state of Lochtenation may at last have reached an uneasy peace, after their rulers, Prince Harry and Ryan Lochte, met at a Las Vegas hotel pool at 3 a.m. Monday morning.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SjpKoD&via=Digg&text=Lochte Trounces Prince Harry In Drunken Vegas Swim Race

div.div: CLIMATE CHANGE

div.a: Arctic Sea Ice To Hit Record Low

div.div: Scientists at the US National Snow and Ice Data Center said data showed that the sea ice extent was tracking below the previous record low, set in 2007.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/MIIXOA&via=Digg&text=Arctic Sea Ice To Hit Record Low

div.div: LAWSUITS

div.a: Casino Fails To Shuffle Cards, Gamblers Make $1.5 Million

div.div: A group of gamblers quickly made $1.5 million after seeing the same sequence of cards dealt, over and over and over again. Now the casino is refusing to pay up.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/MHqems&via=Digg&text=Casino Fails To Shuffle Cards, Gamblers Make $1.5 Million
